body_html: @bhack triSYCL is mainly developed at Xilinx now. Still adding more and more features. The Clang/LLVM-based outlining compiler is still in development to have a full single-source experience on a device. But the OpenCL compatibility mode, already implemented, has some value too, by simplifying the communications between host and kernels with the SYCL runtime doing the lazy transfers according to the dependencies expressed by the accessors.

body: @bhack triSYCL is mainly developed at Xilinx now. Still adding more and more features. The Clang/LLVM-based outlining compiler is still in development to have a full single-source experience on a device. But the OpenCL compatibility mode, already implemented, has some value too, by simplifying the communications between host and kernels with the SYCL runtime doing the lazy transfers according to the dependencies expressed by the accessors.
